data.title: Justin Huish's gear..
data.text:
Here's what I saw in posters and such .. someone confirm this also for me

though.

Silver (chrome) Avalon (or was it a modified Avalon?) with what looked like

C+ Limbs don't know what poundage

Sure Loc FITA Exterme Chrome Sight

Silver Doinker Long bar, V-bars and looks like a doinker Billy Bar (v-bar

bolt)

X10 arrows don't know what size

Looks like a Beiter arm guard and a Caveliear Elite Finger Tab

String I have no clue, but I heard somewhere it was ASB Dyneema or DynaFlyte

97.

Anything else?

>While I don't know his equipment, I do know what part of his makeup you

>DO NOT want. His EGO and ATTITUDE. Talk about your UGLY AMERICANS I was

>quite embarrassed by his appearances on national and international T.V.

>BTW, I live about 15 miles from His Highass errrr ummm Highness.

>

>(Anyone else??)

>

>wPm

>

William, I often think your messages here make sense. This time I think you're

way out of line. You not only don't know his equipment, you don't know Justin

Huish. Your geographic proximity isn't helping either. My experience with

Justin stretches over 9 years and I have NEVER seem him do ANYTHING to justify

your attack. Do I think he's God's gift to archery ? No, but I have NEVER

seen him exhibit excessive ego or an "ugly american" attitude. How many trips

have YOU taken with Justin ? How many times have YOU shot with him ? What's

your problem ? What did he do to embarass YOU ? Win the Olympic Games ? Show

total courtesy to his competitors ? Yeah he did that. Sorry you were

embarassed. Run a victory lap after winning the Gold Medal ? Yeah, he did that

too. Sign autographs for every kid in reach ? Spend time in the stands with

the spectators ? Put his TWO gold medals around ANYONE's neck that wanted to

try 'em on ? Promote youth archery ? Yeah he did that too. Sorry you're

embarassed. Meanwhile he'll go on promoting archery, helping grow the sport

and occasionally kicking my ass in competition. Too bad you're embarassed

about it.

Ronny Yurong wrote:

> go get your attitude adjusted, nobody deserve what you have said about

> JUSTIN, especially when you cannot beat him in archery,

Whether the previous poster can beat him in archery, or anything else,

is completely beside the point.

I had read that Justin Huish is a bit on the energetic, flamboyant side

(...for an archer, perhaps). I'd never before read anything about his

being arrogant or impolite or whatever. One post won't change my mind

about that, but I'm wondering what prompted it.

...one thing I do know, though: I don't want to live next door to a guy

who shoots arrows through his garage at a target across the street! (at

least I think that was the regimen shown on TV during the Olympics

coverage...anyone?)

Ken

With folks that do anything extremely well there is a high level of

confidence and single mindedness that can be interpreted as arogance

or a huge ego. If you get to know these folks a little better you

realize that they are generally great people.

Perhaps this is what is happening with Justin Huish.

The shot through the garage and such was pretty clearly a publicity

thing. It would be stupid to do this on a routine basis, it just isn't

safe.

It's especially stupid since there are places to shoot in California.

You might have to drive for a while, but folks in California are used

to driving.

Marty Sasaki

Ken Laux wrote:

> Whether the previous poster can beat him in archery, or anything else,

> is completely beside the point.

Thanks you..

> I had read that Justin Huish is a bit on the energetic, flamboyant side

> (...for an archer, perhaps). I'd never before read anything about his

> being arrogant or impolite or whatever. One post won't change my mind

> about that, but I'm wondering what prompted it.

He made a statement (at the Olympics) that he was so good that on the

last day he didn't have to shoot an arrow to win. To me that is a

terrible lack of sportsmanship. Then of course, you could run over to

his shop(the one his parents opened to support his hobby) and check it

out for yourselves.

> ...one thing I do know, though: I don't want to live next door to a guy

> who shoots arrows through his garage at a target across the street! (at

> least I think that was the regimen shown on TV during the Olympics

> coverage...anyone?)

Absolutely correct, only in reverse. He shoot from across the street,

into and through his garage. Must have been a scary time in Simi Valley.

I know in my town (Sunland,CA, just minutes from his) this would not be

allowed under any circumstance

Just my opinion

î—“

<< From: William Pearson <buff...@jps.net>

Date: Thu, 03 June 1999 02:28 PM EDT

Message-id: <3756C961...@jps.net>

>>

<< While I don't know his equipment, I do know what part of his makeup you

DO NOT want. His EGO and ATTITUDE. Talk about your UGLY AMERICANS I was

quite embarrassed by his appearances on national and international T.V.

BTW, I live about 15 miles from His Highass errrr ummm Highness.

(Anyone else??) >>

From past meetings involving Justin I know where you might have mistakenly

gotten the impression that he had an attitude. I have found out that he always

has been preoccupied with schedules, personnal committments, and with whatever

it took for him to stay focused. I have found that with a little patience for

him to adjust his focus from what he is doing at the moment you aproach him to

focus then to your meeting is rewarding. He has posed for photos, joked about

my daughter to me, and never ignored a request that was waited for.

Remember just being preoccupied is not a measure of his attitude.

Anthony Moscarelli
